reviews.review: This is a glitchy mess of a game, and it's the best glitchy mess I know about. From floating scientists to the first HECU unit not eliminating a scientist, all the way to the blinding skybox glitch. some might hurt your eyes, but they're mostly humorous.
Awesome game and soundtrack, but terrible version.
Que dire sur un jeu qui est tellement beau graphiquement, avec un Let's Play juste magnifique...

This is probably the OG of lazy and generally awful remasters, yet for some bizarre reason it has seemingly evaded widespread critique despite some unacceptable bugs and non-existent Support. 

The game essentially ports the original Half Life from its Goldsource engine into the original Source. The end result is some slight graphical improvements, however the changeover has brought a host of visual and audio bugs which to this day have not been fixed and never will be. 

It really is shocking that Valve published it in this state, abandoned it completely and still have the audacity to charge such such a high price. Not worth it even if it was free.

lol, so I have three versions of the first Half life now.

So I played a modded version of the game that fixes a lot of the bugs, and doesn't track my playtime at all. And despite that mod, i still can look down and not be hit by sentries at all. Ignoring the bugs, and mainly just for story half life is an amazing game. But please, unless you really want widescreen and are willing to mod it, don't buy this. Buy the original one, or Black Mesa purely for Xen alone.
